member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES
member.summary: Contains information about the power capabilities of the system.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.PowerButtonPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there is a system power button.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SleepButtonPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there is a system sleep button.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.LidPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there is a lid switch.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemS1
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the operating system supports sleep state S1.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemS2
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the operating system supports sleep state S2.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemS3
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the operating system supports sleep state S3.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemS4
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the operating system supports sleep state S4 (hibernation).

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemS5
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the operating system supports power off state S5 (soft off).

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.HiberFilePresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system hibernation file is present.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.FullWake
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports wake capabilities.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.VideoDimPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports video display dimming capabilities.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.ApmPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports APM BIOS power management features.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.UpsPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there is an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.ThermalControl
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports thermal zones.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.ProcessorThrottle
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports processor throttling.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.ProcessorMinThrottle
member.summary: The minimum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.ProcessorMaxThrottle
member.summary: The maximum level of system processor throttling supported, expressed as a percentage.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.FastSystemS4
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports the hybrid sleep state.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.WakeAlarmPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the platform has support for ACPI wake alarm devices. For more details on wake alarm devices, please see the ACPI specification section 9.18.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.AoAc
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports the S0 low power idle model.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.DiskSpinDown
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system supports allowing the removal of power to fixed disk devices.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.spare3
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SystemBatteriesPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, there are one or more batteries in the system.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.BatteriesAreShortTerm
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system batteries are short-term. Short-term batteries are used in uninterruptible power supplies (UPS).

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.BatteryScale
member.summary: A structure that contains information about how system battery metrics are reported.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.AcOnLineWake
member.summary: The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event when the system is on AC power. This member must be one of the enumeration type values.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.SoftLidWake
member.summary: The lowest system sleep state (Sx) that will generate a wake event via the lid switch. This member must be one of the enumeration type values.

summary.para: The lowest system sleep state (Sx) supported by hardware that will generate a wake event via the Real Time Clock (RTC). This member must be one of the enumeration type values.

To wake the computer using the RTC, the operating system must also support waking from the sleep state the computer is in when the RTC generates the wake event. Therefore, the effective lowest sleep state from which an RTC wake event can wake the computer is the lowest sleep state supported by the operating system that is equal to or higher than the value of RtcWake. To determine the sleep states that the operating system supports, check the SystemS1, SystemS2, SystemS3, and SystemS4 members.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.MinDeviceWakeState
member.summary: The minimum allowable system power state supporting wake events. This member must be one of the enumeration type values. Note that this state may change as different device drivers are installed on the system.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.DefaultLowLatencyWake
member.summary: The default system power state used if an application calls withLT_LOWEST_LATENCY. This member must be one of the enumeration type values.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_CAPABILITIES.HiberBoot
member.summary: If this member is set to TRUE, the system is currently capable of performing a fast startup transition. This setting is based on whether the machine is capable of hibernate, whether the machine currently has hibernate enabled (hiberfile exists), and the local and group policy settings for using hibernate (including the Hibernate option in the Power control panel).
